text: hey guys it's angel today's video is for
those of you who requested a shrimp
recipe so it's thumbs up if you guys are
shrimp lovers because I am going to show
you how to make a crispy shrimp also
sometimes known as salt-and-pepper
shrimp now if you guys are wondering yes
you can eat the entire shrimp whole from
head to tail and even the shell because
it's super crispy when we cook it so
with that let's get started on the
ingredients for this recipe we'll need
3/4 of a pound of whole shrimp including
the head start by trimming off the legs
and antennae from the shrimp making sure
to keep the shell and tail intact when
you're done trimming rinse well with
cold water drain and marinate in a bowl
with 1 tablespoon of rice wine and 2
tablespoons of all-purpose flour next
we'll prepare the seasonings slice 1
jalapeno or green pepper chopped 2 to 3
cloves of garlic and prepare some green
onions for garnish we'll also premix 1
teaspoon of salt and a few dashes of
white pepper in a small dish now it's
time to cook heat 2 tablespoons of oil
and stir fry the garlic pieces until
just browned and remove and set aside on
a paper towel then add more oil to your
wok and deep fry the shrimp in small
batches for 2 minutes taking care not to
overcook when they're done remove and
set aside on paper towels while the
shrimp is cooling pour away the oil so
you're starting with the dry wok and
quickly dry fry the shrimp for another
30 seconds to a minute with the
remaining seasonings and salt mixture
and you're done so that's my
salt-and-pepper shrimp recipe as I
mentioned before if you follow this
cooking technique at home your shrimp is
going to be super crispy so yes you can
eat everything from head to tail and
even the shell now for those of you who
have had this recipe before I want to
know how aventuras is your shrimp eating
palate do you eat the entire shrimp or
are you one of those people who kind of
just peels everything and just eats the
inside let me know in the comments below
and of course thank you guys so much for
watching thumbs up if you like a shrimp
video recipe and I will see you guys
soon bye for now
you
